template_variants.short: I see this task relates to committee participation ({{title}}). To meet the requirement for {{month}}, upload one or more of: meeting invite showing your name, the meeting agenda with your role listed, minutes that record your contribution, or an email confirming your attendance.
template_variants.coach: When coaching, ask for the meeting invite and agenda first. If the staff cannot provide formal minutes, accept an email confirmation plus notes explaining the contribution. Encourage uploading a brief reflective note describing the role taken.

template_variants.short: To meet this task ({{title}}) for {{month}}, consider uploading clear artefacts such as an agenda, a signed attendance list, a screenshot of a meeting record, or a short reflective note explaining your contribution.
template_variants.detailed: Evidence guidance for {{title}}: start with items that directly show participation (invites, minutes, signed registers). Complement with artifacts that show your role (slides, authored documents) and add a short note that describes your contribution and dates.

template_variants.short: This specific task ({title}) expects curriculum evidence. Upload: the curriculum document with your name on it, module outlines, or assessment rubrics dated for {{month}}.
template_variants.detailed: Task {title} ({{month}}): Required evidence includes the curriculum document with author/editor listed, assessment rubrics, and a short reflective note describing changes made. If available, include LMS screenshots showing materials published for students.

template_variants.short: For teaching tasks ({{title}}), typical evidence: lesson plans, slides, assessment briefs, LMS exports, and student feedback. Aim for {{evidence_count}} clear items.
template_variants.detailed: Teaching & Learning evidence guidance for {{title}}: include lesson plans with dates, slide decks or handouts, assessment briefs/rubrics, gradebook exports or moderation reports, and any student feedback excerpts. Add a short note explaining how these artefacts demonstrate attainment of the stated learning outcomes.

template_variants.short: Nice work You planned learning activities that matter For this task upload a teaching artefact such as a lesson plan a slide deck or an assessment rubric and add a short note describing your role and the date
template_variants.coach: Ask for a clear teaching artefact and a short reflective note that links the artefact to student learning outcomes Keep files named with the module and month

template_variants.short: Wow great initiative You are showing strong community engagement For this task upload a clear artefact such as an outreach report photos or a summary of activities and include a one line note about the community reached and the date Remember to confirm permission from external partners if needed
template_variants.coach: Encourage staff to provide a short outreach report and evidence of community participation If external partners are involved ask for written permission or an MoU before sharing sensitive data

template_variants.short: For HISE411 consider a slide deck, a sample of student feedback or an assessment rubric. For HISE322 consider an LMS screenshot or export, a gradebook export or a sample of anonymized student feedback. Add a short one line note to each file and name files so they include the module code for easy lookup.
